page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Maidstone has grown into a thriving commercial centre and an important market town from being a small river settlement in prehistoric times. Maidstone is an area of considerable archeological and historical importance. There have been remains found dating back to Palaelothic and Neolithic times. The area includes part of the track known as the Pilgrims' Way, one of the most important pre-Roman roads in England. We also know that a Roman road ran through Maidstone. The town received its first charter in 1549. MAIDSTONE'S NAME The most likely origin is Anglo-Saxon. It was known as "Medweyestun" (Medway's Town) and later in the Domesday Book as "Meddestane" (The Mid-town). The name was later interpreted as "the town of the Maidens"
